scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Clavia Goodman series comprises manuscripts (short stories, poetry, and verse) and draft and notes for Bitter Harvest, a biography of Clavia's aunt and noted suffragette, Laura Clay. The series includes letters, notebooks, and papers from when Clavia attended boarding schools, Grovely Manor School, Boscombe, Bournemouth, Dorset, England and Lyngholt School, Hindhead, England in the 1910's through 1923. It also contains diaries and travel logs from 1931-1970. Lastly, the series includes two scrapbooks: one with ephemera from a trip to Austria in 1932 and another honoring murdered Austrian Chancellor Englebert Dolfuss made in 1934.
